scenarioDescription:
The HIP 35173 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HIP 35173 is a star with 0.79 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 108.14 light years away from the solar system.

HIP 35173 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HIP 35173 system


HIP 35173 b

HIP 35173 b was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory observatory, in 2019-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.22 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HIP 35173 b is 12.707 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HIP 35173 b is 3.610 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HIP 35173 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HIP 35173, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory.
name: HIP 35173 - System With 1 Exoplanet
